court: Change de Nancy (appellate), Prévôt of Arches (local jurisdiction)

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: became deaf and blind despite her treatment

witnesses.name: Nicolas fils de feu Mathieu la Breuche

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused of gossiping and creating disputes between neighbors

witnesses.name: Estienne Lallemant
witnesses.occupation: controlleur en la gruyerie du val de Ramonchamp

testimony.quarrel_subject: caught her stealing pears from his tree, had her fined
testimony.threat_quote: que ceux qui boiroient de cet argent, s'en repentiroient

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: not long after drinking purchased with fine money (18 months before testimony)

timeline.subject: Remiere Beustal
timeline.details: Preliminary investigations begun after denunciation by Chretienne Parmentier (though she had withdrawn it)

timeline.subject: Remiere Beustal
timeline.details: First interrogation; she claimed to be about 50 years old, denied accusations, recited healing prayers

timeline.subject: Remiere Beustal
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; no serious reproaches. Confronted with Chretienne Parmentier who confirmed accusations

timeline.subject: Remiere Beustal
timeline.details: Second confrontation with Chretienne Parmentier, who withdrew all accusations saying she made them 'a la suasion de quelque particulier'

timeline.subject: Remiere Beustal
timeline.details: PG des Vosges requests question ordinaire et extraordinaire, citing strong presumptions including superstitious and diabolical prayers

timeline.subject: Remiere Beustal
timeline.details: Change de Nancy asks for case to be held over until case against Chretienne Parmentier is completed

timeline.subject: Remiere Beustal
timeline.details: PG des Vosges reiterates previous demands for torture

timeline.subject: Remiere Beustal
timeline.details: Change de Nancy recommends she be renvoyée (released) unless PG produces additional evidence

timeline.subject: Remiere Beustal
timeline.details: Prévôt of Arches orders her released as recommended by court at Nancy, with warning not to use superstitious prayers

torture.restrictions: Request denied by Change de Nancy

prior_accusations.context: Initial denunciation that triggered the investigation, but she withdrew the accusations

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Godel (witness 1)
notable_quotes.french: prouvenant ledit soubcon, de ce qu'elle s'est tousjours meslée et se mesle de guerir du bestail et de l'asseurer, comme aussy les personnes, leurs donnant des herbes
notable_quotes.english: the suspicion arising from the fact that she has always meddled and meddles in healing animals and protecting them, as well as people, giving them herbs
notable_quotes.context: Explaining the basis for her reputation as a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Delat Godel (witness 2)
notable_quotes.context: Why moictrier François Claude Anthoine did not want to stay there after quarrel with Remiere

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Mercier (witness 4)
notable_quotes.french: Au reste qu'elle a les mains tellement crochue qu'elle prent et emporte ce qu'elle trouve
notable_quotes.english: Moreover, she has such crooked hands that she takes and carries off what she finds
notable_quotes.context: Accusing her of theft, describing her as having 'hooked hands'

notable_quotes.speaker: Magdellaine femme Jean Mercier (witness 5)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle guerit le bestail et l'asseure en sorte que sy aucune beste couche aux champs, le loup ne scauroit encore que tout proche luy nuire
notable_quotes.english: that she heals animals and protects them so that if any beast sleeps in the fields, the wolf cannot harm it even though very close
notable_quotes.context: Describing her healing and protective powers over animals

notable_quotes.speaker: Delatte femme Jean Martin Colé (witness 15)
notable_quotes.french: une causeuse et menteuse ayant plusieurs fois semé de la zizanie entre elle deposante et ses voisins taschant de les mettre en querelles
notable_quotes.english: a gossip and liar having several times sown discord between her (the witness) and her neighbors, trying to put them in quarrels
notable_quotes.context: Describing Remiere's character and social behavior

notable_quotes.speaker: Remiere Beustal (accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il les falloit signer neufs jours durantz
notable_quotes.english: that it was necessary to make the sign [of the cross] over them for nine days
notable_quotes.context: Explaining her healing ritual for eye troubles

notable_quotes.speaker: Boys teasing Remiere's son Claudon
notable_quotes.french: qu'ils le prendroient, s'il ne disoit, qu'il avoit esté au sabat avec sa mere et qu'on y mangeoit du noir pelat, et millot
notable_quotes.english: that they would catch him if he didn't say that he had been to the sabbat with his mother and that they ate 'black pellet' and millet there
notable_quotes.context: Children bullying Remiere's 6-year-old son while herding calves

notable_quotes.speaker: Remiere Beustal about Delatte
notable_quotes.french: une femme a laquelle il n'y a point d'estime
notable_quotes.english: a woman to whom there is no esteem

notable_quotes.speaker: Remiere Beustal via Nicolas Godel reproach
notable_quotes.french: un homme qui ne tient ses parolles
notable_quotes.english: a man who does not keep his word
notable_quotes.context: Remiere's counter-accusation against witness Nicolas Godel

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Parmentier
notable_quotes.english: a fool and a wanton woman
notable_quotes.context: Insulting Remiere during confrontation before withdrawing accusations

notable_quotes.speaker: Chretienne Parmentier
notable_quotes.french: a la suasion de quelque particulier
notable_quotes.english: at the persuasion of some individual
notable_quotes.context: Explaining why she made false accusations against Remiere

notable_quotes.speaker: Estienne Lallemant reporting Remiere (witness 16)
notable_quotes.french: que ceux qui boiroient de cet argent, s'en repentiroient
notable_quotes.english: that those who would drink from that money would regret it
notable_quotes.context: Threat allegedly made after being fined for stealing pears

notable_quotes.speaker: Delatte femme Jean Martin Colé (witness 15)
notable_quotes.context: How Remiere denied being out at night when confronted

relationships.evidence_text: Asked if she was relative, said she was his cousin

relationships.person1: Nicolas fils de feu Mathieu la Breuche

François Claude Anthoine, moictrier of his late father
his brothers-in-law Nicolas and Philippe Godel
his brothers-in-law Nicolas and Philippe Godel
had seen her steal wood from outside house of Nicolas Cosme
learned from wife of Nicolas Lambert
Chretienne Parmentier had been in his service then

economic_context.details: Multiple accusations of theft (wood, pears, general stealing). Her husband successfully had Nicolas Martin Colé fined for calling her a witch. She was fined for stealing pears from Estienne Lallemant's tree. Witnesses repeatedly describe her as having 'crooked hands' or 'light hands' (euphemisms for theft). Economic stress evident in theft patterns and her role as informal healer (perhaps compensated).

harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft (she was around trying to heal them)

animal_predation: Wolves mentioned in context of Remiere's protective magic - she could protect animals sleeping in fields so wolves couldn't harm them even if close by

Her children called 'noir pelat' (black pellet) - possible poverty insult
Economic value of animals evident in testimonies about livestock losses

prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Fined (through her husband who was still alive)

legal_context.redress_outcome: Successfully had Nicolas Martin Colé fined for calling her witch
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Does not appear to have been imprisoned during interrogation - 'Does not sound as if she was in prison'

hearsay_chains.content: heard Chretienne Parmentier accuse her of killing cow of moictrier
Heard from Didier Boileau that she said 'those who drink from that money will regret it'
servants told him about cat which got into stable when cow died

emotional_state_notes: Claimed to have no idea of nature of accusation
Defended her healing prayers as approved by experience

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Nicolas Godel was 'un homme qui ne tient ses parolles' (a man who does not keep his word)
Delatte femme Jean Martin Colé was 'une femme a laquelle il n'y a point d'estime' (a woman to whom there is no esteem)

third_parties.name: Chretienne Parmentier
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: was servant of François Claudel Anthoine
third_parties.context: Made initial denunciation that triggered investigation but withdrew it; later confronted with Remiere and called her 'genoche' and 'ribaulde' before withdrawing accusations again, saying she made them at someone's persuasion

third_parties.name: Claudon (son of Remiere)
third_parties.context: 6 years old; other boys teased him while herding calves, saying they'd catch him if he didn't say he went to sabbat with his mother and ate 'noir pelat' and millet there

third_parties.name: wife of Nicolas Lambert

third_parties.name: Didier Boileau
third_parties.context: Miller who had bad leg; heard threat about cursed money; also testified as witness 17

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a particularly rich trial record with detailed witness testimony, clear timeline, and important legal context. Remiere Beustal was a healer-witch who survived her trial despite PG des Vosges requesting torture. The Change de Nancy's intervention was crucial to her release. The trial shows the complex social dynamics around healing, theft accusations, and reputation. The withdrawal of Chretienne Parmentier's accusations was significant. Notable elements include the children's taunting of her son about sabbat attendance, the detailed healing prayers (referenced by Delcambre numbers), and the curse allegedly placed on fine money that led to multiple child deaths. The trial demonstrates how healing activities could both provide social standing and generate suspicion.
